content: @Santiago Pastorino can you elaborate what I should confirm here? https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/73420#issuecomment-649777426
I mean, unsure who is the one that catches the relnotes issues and how do they do that
but I guess the process involves checking closed issues/prs?

@XAMPPRocky -- do you know? I guess we probably have docs somewhere

presumably you've run the tooling on 1.45 though and don't plan to run it again?

@Santiago Pastorino How the release notes works is usually a week or two after the previous release I will run the relnotes tool (linked below), which catches all merged PRs during the six weeks between cutoffs.

https://github.com/rust-lang/relnotes

@simulacrum There isn't much point in running it again, since it generates a full list, I currently don't have an easy to see things that were backported. I would say the best way to raise after I've made the PR is to post in the PR and/or ping me.
does a github ping work fine for you?
Yep that would be the ideal ping in fact. :slight_smile:

XAMPPRocky said:

Santiago Pastorino How the relase notes works is usually a week or two after the previous release I will run the relnotes tool (linked below), which catches all merged PRs during the six weeks between cutoffs.

https://github.com/rust-lang/relnotes

simulacrum There isn't much point in running it again, since it generates a full list, I currently don't have an easy to see things that were backported. I would say the best way to raise after I've made the PR is to post in the PR and/or ping me.

note that this is not a PR but an issue, will the tool catch that too?
in this case it's about a beta backport so tool catching it won't matter, it's too late
@simulacrum I didn't understand what you meant, I was talking about adding some notes about the LLVM change
Erin isn't going to run the tool for 1.45 (current beta) again, and this would need to be added to 1.45 notes
in any case my original request is already answered, we shouldn't close this issue :)
@Santiago Pastorino Issues are ignored by the tool. It has to be a pull request.
ok, so what do you both mean in concrete?
what do we need to do to add these notes for the release
